definitions.definition: the power or right to act, speak, or think as one wants without hindrance or restraint.
examples: we do have some freedom of choice

definitions.definition: absence of subjection to foreign domination or despotic government.
examples: he was a champion of Irish freedom
synonyms: autonomy; democracy "revolution was the only path to freedom"

definitions.definition: the state of not being imprisoned or enslaved.
examples: the shark thrashed its way to freedom
synonyms: discharge; Moreliterarydisenthrallment; historicalmanumission "a desperate bid for freedom"

definitions.definition: the state of being physically unrestricted and able to move easily.
examples: the shorts have a side split for freedom of movement

definitions.definition: the state of not being subject to or affected by (a particular undesirable thing).
examples: noun: freedom from; plural noun: freedom froms

definitions.definition: the power of self-determination attributed to the will; the quality of being independent of fate or necessity.
examples: right, entitlement, privilege, prerogative; Morescope, latitude, leeway, flexibility, space, breathing space, room, elbow room; license, leave, free rein, a free hand, carte blanche, a blank check "freedom to choose your course of treatment"Morescope, latitude, leeway, flexibility, space, breathing space, room, elbow room; license, leave, free rein, a free hand, carte blanche, a blank check freedom to choose your course of treatment
the dog is happy having the freedom of the house when we are out

definitions.definition: familiarity or openness in speech or behavior.
